content:
This section provides examples of LINQ to XML projections and transformations.

In This Section

Topic Description
How to: Work with Dictionaries Using LINQ to XML (Visual Basic) Shows how to transform dictionaries to XML, and how to transform XML into dictionaries.
How to: Transform the Shape of an XML Tree (Visual Basic) Shows how to transform the shape of an XML document.
How to: Control the Type of a Projection (Visual Basic) Shows how to control the type of a LINQ to XML query.
How to: Project a New Type (LINQ to XML) (Visual Basic) Shows how to project a collection of a user-defined type from a LINQ to XML query.
How to: Project an Object Graph (Visual Basic) Shows how to project a more complex object graph from a LINQ to XML query.
How to: Project an Anonymous Type (Visual Basic) Shows how to project a collection of anonymous objects from a LINQ to XML query.
How to: Generate Text Files from XML (Visual Basic) Shows how to transform an XML file to a non-XML text file.
How to: Generate XML from CSV Files (Visual Basic) Shows how to use LINQ to parse a CSV file and generate XML from it.

See Also

Querying XML Trees (Visual Basic)
